text.__SUMMARY__:
Quercus durata, the California scrub oak, or leather oak, is an oak endemic to California.
Quercus durata var. durata is a strict serpentine endemic that grows in the Coast Ranges and northern Sierra Nevada.  It is often a component of serpentine chaparral.Quercus durata is an evergreen shrub occasionally reaching 3 meters (10 feet) in height but usually much shorter. Leaves are rarely flat, usually cupped, with a thick layer of small branching hairs on the underside making it feel like felt.
text.Cultivation: Quercus durata is often used as an urban tree and medicinal plant.
